text.0_Piyyut, 1_Verse: I first ask permission and approval
text.0_Piyyut, 2_Verse: To start with two or three stanzas in fear
text.0_Piyyut, 3_Verse: Of God who creates and ever sustains.
text.0_Piyyut, 4_Verse: He has endless might, not to be described
text.0_Piyyut, 5_Verse: Were the skies parchment, were all the reeds quills,
text.0_Piyyut, 6_Verse: Were the seas and all waters made of ink,
text.0_Piyyut, 7_Verse: Were all the world’s inhabitants made scribes.
text.0_Piyyut, 8_Verse: The glorious Lord of heaven and earth,
text.0_Piyyut, 9_Verse: Alone, formed the world, veiled in mystery.
text.0_Piyyut, 10_Verse: Without exertion did he perfect it,
text.0_Piyyut, 11_Verse: Only by a light sign, without substance.
text.0_Piyyut, 12_Verse: He accomplished all his work in six days;
text.0_Piyyut, 13_Verse: His glory ascended a throne of fire.
text.0_Piyyut, 14_Verse: Millions of legions are at his service;
text.0_Piyyut, 15_Verse: Fresh each morning they flourish with great faith.
text.0_Piyyut, 16_Verse: More glowing are the six-winged seraphim,
text.0_Piyyut, 17_Verse: Who keep silence till leave is given them.
text.0_Piyyut, 18_Verse: Without delay they call to one another:
text.0_Piyyut, 19_Verse: “God’s majestic splendor fills the whole earth!”
text.0_Piyyut, 20_Verse: Like a mighty thunder, like ocean’s roar,
text.0_Piyyut, 21_Verse: The cherubim and the spheres rise loudly
text.0_Piyyut, 22_Verse: To gaze at the rainbowlike appearance.
text.0_Piyyut, 24_Verse: Whispering praise in each tongue: “Blessed be
text.0_Piyyut, 25_Verse: His glory in his entire universe.”
text.0_Piyyut, 26_Verse: All the heavenly hosts shout praise in awe:
text.0_Piyyut, 28_Verse: Their hymn is timed; when the hour is gone,
text.0_Piyyut, 29_Verse: They shall at no period chant it again.
text.0_Piyyut, 30_Verse: Dear to him are the people of Israel,
text.0_Piyyut, 31_Verse: Acclaiming him each morning and evening.
text.0_Piyyut, 32_Verse: They are dedicated to do his will;
text.0_Piyyut, 33_Verse: His wonders, his praises, they declare hourly.
text.0_Piyyut, 34_Verse: He desires them to toil in the Torah,
text.0_Piyyut, 35_Verse: So that their prayer be well accepted,
text.0_Piyyut, 36_Verse: Bound up in the crown of the Eternal,
text.0_Piyyut, 37_Verse: Securely set near the precious frontlet.
text.0_Piyyut, 38_Verse: His frontlet is most skillfully inscribed:
text.0_Piyyut, 39_Verse: “Great is Israel who proclaims God’s Oneness.”
text.0_Piyyut, 40_Verse: The praise of the world’s Lord, in pure homage,
text.0_Piyyut, 41_Verse: I am pleased to declare before the kings.
text.0_Piyyut, 42_Verse: They come and gather like the surging waves,
text.0_Piyyut, 43_Verse: Wondering and asking about the signs:
text.0_Piyyut, 44_Verse: Whence and who is your beloved, O fair one?
text.0_Piyyut, 45_Verse: For whom do you die in the lion’s den?
text.0_Piyyut, 46_Verse: Most precious are you; if you merge with us,
text.0_Piyyut, 47_Verse: We will do your will in all the regions.
text.0_Piyyut, 48_Verse: With wisdom I answer them concisely:
text.0_Piyyut, 49_Verse: You must recognize and acknowledge him!
text.0_Piyyut, 50_Verse: Of what value is your glory compared
text.0_Piyyut, 51_Verse: With all that God will do for me in due time,
text.0_Piyyut, 52_Verse: When light will come to me and shame to you,
text.0_Piyyut, 53_Verse: When he will reveal himself in great might?
text.0_Piyyut, 54_Verse: He will repay the foes in all the isles;
text.0_Piyyut, 55_Verse: Triumph to the dear and upright people!
text.0_Piyyut, 56_Verse: Perfect joy, pure delight, will come into
text.0_Piyyut, 57_Verse: Jerusalem when he will gather the exiles.
text.0_Piyyut, 58_Verse: His glory will shield Zion day and night,
text.0_Piyyut, 59_Verse: While his tent for praise will be made in it
text.0_Piyyut, 60_Verse: Under a splendid canopy of bright clouds.
text.0_Piyyut, 61_Verse: For each godly man a booth will be made,
text.0_Piyyut, 62_Verse: Furnished with a gold throne of seven steps.
text.0_Piyyut, 63_Verse: The righteous will be arrayed before God,
text.0_Piyyut, 65_Verse: The brilliant sky and the luminous stars –
text.0_Piyyut, 66_Verse: A splendor that no language can describe,
text.0_Piyyut, 67_Verse: That was not heard of nor viewed by prophets.
text.0_Piyyut, 69_Verse: Where the righteous dance in presence of God,
text.0_Piyyut, 71_Verse: For whom we looked in exile with firm faith!
text.0_Piyyut, 72_Verse: He now gently guides us eternally,
text.0_Piyyut, 73_Verse: Granting us the share long reserved for us.:
text.0_Piyyut, 75_Verse: They are locked in combat with each other.
text.0_Piyyut, 76_Verse: Behemoth gores mightily with its horns;
text.0_Piyyut, 77_Verse: The sea-monster counters with potent fins.
text.0_Piyyut, 78_Verse: The Creator slays them with his great sword,
text.0_Piyyut, 79_Verse: And prepares a banquet for the righteous,
text.0_Piyyut, 80_Verse: Who sit in rows at tables of precious stones,
text.0_Piyyut, 81_Verse: While before them there flow streams of balsam,
text.0_Piyyut, 82_Verse: And they indulge themselves and drink full cups
text.0_Piyyut, 83_Verse: Of the precious old wine preserved in vats.
text.0_Piyyut, 84_Verse: You upright, having heard this hymn of praise,
text.0_Piyyut, 85_Verse: May you be in that blissful company!
text.0_Piyyut, 86_Verse: You will merit to sit in the first row
text.0_Piyyut, 87_Verse: If you will obey God’s majestic words.
text.0_Piyyut, 88_Verse: God, exalted from beginning to end,
text.0_Piyyut, 89_Verse: Was pleased with us and gave us the Torah.
